PROMPTER.NAME: CONTROL-MSF_FACILITYHELP
PROMPTER.LINE: The MANTIS Search Facility (MSF) allows you to search for strings within
MANTIS entities. MANTIS programs, descriptions, and fields from screens,
internal and external file views, interfaces, TOTAL file views, and prompters
can be searched for certain criteria.
To conduct a search, enter the search criteria and what strings you wish to
search for in the Search String(s) fields. You can run this program in
Batch MANTIS by running CONTROL:SEARCH_FACILITY by name.
Search Criteria:
Username: This is the user that will be searched. The default is the
current user. You can change the username to search another
user. Only the MASTER user can specify 'MASTER'. Also the
MASTER user can specify an asterisk (*) to search all users.
Password: Required if you wish to search a different user. The MASTER
user is not required to enter a password for other users or
for searching all users with an asterisk (*).
Entity Name: Enter the name of a specific entity you wish to search. The
name can be wildcarded at the end with an asterisk. For
example: CUST* searches all entities beginning with CUST.
You can enter only an asterisk to search all entity names.
Entity Type: The entity type can be one or more different types of
entities to be searched. The default entity type is Programs
on the MSF panel. To change or select different entities
types, enter 6 at the Command Line or press PF6 to display
an entity type selection screen. Place an "S" next to the
type(s) of searches you want and press Enter to fill the
Entity Type field on the MSF panel.
Search Comments?: Enter 'Y'es if you want program comments to be searched
or 'N'o to exclude comments from the search.
Search Descriptions?: Enter 'Y'es if you want entity descriptions to be
included in the search or 'N'o to exclude entity
descriptions from the search.
Saved Search: You can save your search criteria for later use by entering
a name (up to 32 characters) and pressing F7. You can load
previously saved searches from a list by pressing F8. You
can delete saved searches from the list by pressing F9.
Case Sensitive: Entering "Y" indicates that while searching, that case
sensitive values will be used in the supplied search
criteria. Entering "N" (default) excludes case sensitively
from the supplied search criteria.
Print Results: Entering "Y" indicates results of the search be routed to
your designated printer. Entering "N" (default) results of
search will displayed upon your terminal.
Search String(s):
You have up to 9 lines to enter the strings for which you wish to search.
Example: Entering DATE will find all occurrences in entities where the
string DATE appears. Note: this will include strings such as
UPDATE, etc., so you may wish to qualify your search better.
For example: _DATE or :DATE, etc.
Press ENTER to conduct the search. F3 to exit, F5 to refresh the display,
F6 to present an Entity Type Selection List, F7 to save a search, F8 to load
a saved search, F9 to delete a saved search, F12 to Cancel, F15 for the main
MANTIS menu, and F24 to Logoff MANTIS. The Cancel key cancels the search.
